title: Ouled Ali Hammam
text:
Ouled Ali Hammam () is a place located at in <a href="Guelma%20Province">Guelma Province</a> <a href="Algeria">Algeria</a> south of <a href="Bouati%20Mahmoud">Bouati Mahmoud</a>.
The topography is hill country covered in shrubs, and the area is approximately 416 meters above <a href="Sea%20level">Sea level</a>
Since <a href="Roman%20Empire">Roman times</a> the town has been renown for its <a href="Spa">thermal spring</a>s, hence the name: The term "hammam" is translated as "<a href="Turkish%20bath">Turkish bath</a>.
Nearby towns include <a href="Djebel%20Bou%20Chahrene">Djebel Bou Chahrene</a> and <a href="Koudiet%20Mr%C3%A2h%20el%20Ba%E2%80%99dj">Koudiet Mrâh el Ba’dj</a>. <a href="H%C3%A9liopolis%2C%20Algeria">Héliopolis, Algeria</a> is twenty <a href="kilometer">kilometer</a>s to the <a href="south">south</a>.
The <a href="temperature">temperature</a> ranges from 5 °C to around 35°<a href="Celsius">c</a> in <a href="Summer">Summer</a> and rainfall is concentrated in <a href="winter">winter</a> with summers being dry.
